intro: Calandriniopsis sericea, commonly known as the silky calandriniopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, silky-hairy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
